content: The Act titled "Financial Institutions Examination Fairness and Reform Act" mandates timely examination reports under the Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council Act of 1978. The Financial Institutions Examination Fairness and Reform Act requires Federal financial institutions regulatory agencies to provide a final examination report to a financial institution within 60 days of the exit interview or the provision of additional information. If a financial institution is not part of a resident examiner program, the exit interview must occur within 9 months of the examination, with the possibility of extension upon written notice. The Financial Institutions Examination Fairness and Reform Act mandates that Federal financial institutions regulatory agencies must provide a final examination report to a financial institution within 60 days of the exit interview or provision of additional information. If needed, the institution can request an extension for completing the examination, with the Director providing specific reasons for the extension. Additionally, upon request, the agency must include an appendix with all examination or factual information used to support a material supervisory determination in the final report. SEC. 3. INDEPENDENT EXAMINATION REVIEW DIRECTOR. The Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council Act of 1978 is amended to include the creation of the Office of Independent Examination Review. The Office of Independent Examination Review is established within the Council, with the Independent Examination Review Director appointed to head it. The Director can hire staff and investigate complaints from financial institutions regarding examinations. Meetings are held regularly to encourage participation. The Office of Independent Examination Review within the Council conducts examination quality assurance for federal financial institutions, reviews examination procedures, and adjudicates supervisory appeals. The Director of the Office of Independent Examination Review conducts reviews, adjudicates appeals, and reports annually to relevant committees on examination procedures and compliance. The Director must maintain confidentiality of information provided by financial institutions. The Director of the Office of Independent Examination Review conducts reviews, adjudicates appeals, and reports annually to relevant committees on examination procedures and compliance. The term 'Director' refers to the Independent Examination Review Director established under section 1013(a) and (b). SEC. 4. RIGHT TO INDEPENDENT REVIEW OF MATERIAL SUPERVISORY DETERMINATIONS. The Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council Act of 1978 is further amended to include the right to independent review of material supervisory determinations. A financial institution has the right to obtain an independent review of a material supervisory determination in a final examination report. The institution must file a written notice with the Director within 60 days of receiving the report, identifying the determination in question and providing reasons for why it is believed to be incorrect or should be modified. The financial institution has the right to request any information relied upon by the agency in the final report that is not in their possession. The Director can determine the appeal on record or refer it to an administrative law judge for a hearing within 60 days of receiving the petition for review. After receiving the petition for review, an administrative law judge conducting a hearing must issue a proposed decision to the Director. During the hearing, neither the judge nor the Director can defer to the opinions of the examiner or agency, but must independently assess the agency's decision based on relevant statutes, regulations, and evidence presented. The Director's final decision on an independent review must be made based on the record established during the hearing. The review under this section must be completed within 60 days of the record closure and is considered final agency action binding on the agency and financial institution. Financial institutions have the right to petition for judicial review within 60 days of the Director's decision. The Director must report annually to the relevant committees on actions taken. The Director must report annually to the Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs Committee on actions taken under this section. Retaliation against financial institutions for exercising appellate rights is prohibited. Federal financial institutions regulatory agencies cannot delay or deny actions benefiting financial institutions based on pending appeals. SEC. 5. ADDITIONAL AMENDMENTS.
